      • newBuilder

        @Nonnull
public static Tree.Builder newBuilder(@Nonnull
                                               Repository repo,
                                               @Nullable
                                               Tree source)
        Create a new tree builder.

        The tree builder can be used to create or modify trees in memory and write them as tree objects to the database.

        If the `source` parameter is not NULL, the tree builder will be initialized with the entries of the given tree.

        If the `source` parameter is NULL, the tree builder will start with no entries and will have to be filled manually.

        Parameters:
        repo - Repository in which to store the object
        source - Source tree to initialize the builder (optional)
        Returns:
        tree builder
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • entryByName

        @Nonnull
public Optional<Tree.Entry> entryByName(@Nonnull
                                                 String filename)
        Lookup a tree entry by its filename

        This returns a git_tree_entry that is owned by the git_tree. You don't have to free it, but you must not use it after the git_tree is released.

        Parameters:
        filename - the filename of the desired entry
        Returns:
        the tree entry; empty if not found

      • entryByIndex

        @Nonnull
public Optional<Tree.Entry> entryByIndex(int idx)
        Lookup a tree entry by its position in the tree

        This returns a git_tree_entry that is owned by the git_tree. You don't have to free it, but you must not use it after the git_tree is released.

        Parameters:
        idx - the position in the entry list
        Returns:
        the tree entry; empty if not found

      • entryById

        @Nonnull
public Optional<Tree.Entry> entryById(@Nonnull
                                               Oid id)
        Lookup a tree entry by SHA value.

        This returns a git_tree_entry that is owned by the git_tree. You don't have to free it, but you must not use it after the git_tree is released.

        Warning: this must examine every entry in the tree, so it is not fast.

        Parameters:
        id - the sha being looked for
        Returns:
        the tree entry; empty if not found

      • entryByPath

        @Nonnull
public Optional<Tree.Entry> entryByPath(@Nonnull
                                                 Path path)
        Retrieve a tree entry contained in a tree or in any of its subtrees, given its relative path.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the contained entry
        Returns:
        found tree entry; empty if not found
        Throws:
        GitException - 0 on success; GIT_ENOTFOUND if the path does not exist

      • dup

        public Tree dup()
        Description copied from class: GitObject
        Create an copy of a Git object. The copy must be explicitly closed or it will leak.
        Overrides:
        dup in class GitObject
        Returns:
        copy of the object.

      • createUpdated

        @Nonnull
public Oid createUpdated(@Nonnull
                                  Repository repo,
                                  @Nonnull
                                  Tree baseline,
                                  @Nonnull
                                  List<Tree.Update> updates)
        Create a tree based on another one with the specified modifications

        Given the `baseline` perform the changes described in the list of `updates` and create a new tree.

        This function is optimized for common file/directory addition, removal and replacement in trees. It is much more efficient than reading the tree into a `git_index` and modifying that, but in exchange it is not as flexible.

        Deleting and adding the same entry is undefined behaviour, changing a tree to a blob or viceversa is not supported.

        Parameters:
        repo - the repository in which to create the tree, must be the same as for `baseline`
        baseline - the tree to base these changes on
        updates - the list of updates to perform
        Returns:
        id of the new tree
